channel.title: [Tut] Model Outlining [Tut]
channel.description:
Well, since the old topic of Mr. Linksys has been removed i tought that i would [b]Redo[/b] the tutorial about Picture Outlining with Metasequoia.
Well...
Here we go!
[s]Downloading Metasequoia.[/s]
[b]Metasequoia Download[/b] http://www.metaseq.net/metaseq/metaseq249.zip
Ok , now you have Metasequoia.
[b]Picture Outlining[/b]
Ok. first you need a picture, google one on Http://www.google.com/ .
Now if you have a picture. you need to make a new Mat(erial).
How to do this.. well simply on your Mat(erial) Panel click on "New" [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_33Nov301300.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_36Nov301301.jpg[/img]
Now double click on "mat1" and you will see something like this:
Click on [b]Ref[/b]
[IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/RefClick.jpg[/img]
And choose the picture that you want to outline. When you found the picture that you want to outline click on open and then ok on the Material Property window.
Now click on Primitive
[IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/Primitive.jpg[/img]
And it would look like this
[IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/Primitivelook.jpg[/img]
Shape it as big as the window.
and click on [b]Create[/b]
it will looks something like this :
[IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/GuitarThing.jpg[/img]
*Note : don't mind the picture that i used i randomly clicked one.
Now you need to click on Create. it's somewhere underneath Primitive ;) Choose [b] [Both] and [line] [/b] Instead of [b] [Front] and [Face] [/b]
[b] !!!IMPORTANT!!! Be Sure To Make Another Object. So you Have Obj1 ( Your Picture) and Obj2 ( This is going to be the outlining) Click On Obj2 Before Outlining!!!!!!!)[/b]
Now you can start outlining it should look something like this:
[IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/Outlining.jpg[/img]
If you outlined your picture you can delete Obj1 and go further modelling your model.
Hope I Helped You.
-Assassins Creed Fan.
*Note [b] Post Questions about this if needed.[/b]

item.title: [Tut] Model Outlining [Tut]
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Gamerstips, post:5, topic:267263”]This doesnt help much, because DatMaker doesnt recognize textures.

Well… Good tutorial[/quote]

This isnt applying a textures to a model, Its how to set a background image so you can copy the picture exactly. Please read the post before replying.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] Model Outlining [Tut]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

Well, since the old topic of Mr. Linksys has been removed i tought that i would Redo the tutorial about Picture Outlining with Metasequoia.

Well…

Here we go!

Downloading Metasequoia.

Metasequoia Download
http://www.metaseq.net/metaseq/metaseq249.zip

Ok , now you have Metasequoia.

Picture Outlining

Ok. first you need a picture, google one on Http://www.google.com/ .

Now if you have a picture. you need to make a new Mat(erial).

How to do this… well simply on your Mat(erial) Panel click on “New”

Now double click on “mat1” and you will see something like this:

Click on Ref

RefClick.jpg789×582

And choose the picture that you want to outline.
When you found the picture that you want to outline click on open and then ok on the Material Property window.

Now click on Primitive

And it would look like this

Primitivelook.jpg1024×768

Shape it as big as the window.

and click on Create

it will looks something like this :

GuitarThing.jpg1024×768

*Note : don’t mind the picture that i used i randomly clicked one.

Now you need to click on Create. it’s somewhere underneath Primitive
Choose [Both] and [line]
Instead of [Front] and [Face]

!!!IMPORTANT!!!
Be Sure To Make Another Object. So you Have Obj1 ( Your Picture) and Obj2 ( This is going to be the outlining)
Click On Obj2 Before Outlining!!!)

Now you can start outlining it should look something like this:

Outlining.jpg1024×768

If you outlined your picture you can delete Obj1 and go further modelling your model.

Hope I Helped You.

-Assassins Creed Fan.

*Note Post Questions about this if needed.

Read full topic
